Many forms of Government have been tried, and will be tried in this world of sin and woe. No one pretends that democracy is perfect or all-wise. Indeed it has been said that democracy is the worst form of Government except for all those other forms that have been tried from time to time.

– Winston Churchill

content.content:
Dividing this topic is intended to provide a clearer and more user-friendly structure; it is not meant to suggest a view of modern media.

Today, there is no clear-cut divide between old media, also called 'legacy media', and new media. Newspapers have made the transition to the internet and have absorbed content from bloggers, Twitter, Instagram and other social media. TV channels have a strong social media presence and a lot of the advertising we are exposed to every day reach us through influencers and social media ads. There is no longer a strong division between the professional and the private when it comes to delivering media content.

content.content:
Dividing this topic is intended to provide a clearer and more user-friendly structure; it is not meant to suggest a view of modern media.

Today, there is no clear-cut divide between new media and old media. However, when most of us think of social media and gaming we tend to think of something that is created and/or used by ordinary people, not people who are employed to create content. Influencers, Youtubers and professional gamers blur those lines. We also see a strong social media presence from traditional mass media, which makes such distinctions far from accurate.
